values:
Venue: Oh Yeah Music Centre
Event: The Pogues [Rum & Sodomy Revisited]

So I had to fill an hour or so after this gig with music that would be enjoyed or endured by people who were fans of The Pogues. That could be folk, punk, indie, country, anything really... right?

Here's what they got:

Your Vandal Interlude: Duke Special
I Wish I Was A Punk Rocker: Sandi Thom
The Pirate's Gospel: Alela Diane
Car Bomb: 180G's
Thatcher Fucked The Kids: Frank Turner
Little Liza Jane: Alison Krauss & Union Station
Maggie's Farm: Bob Dylan
Our Love: Rhett Miller
Killamangiro: Babyshambles
The Wild Rover: Dropkick Murphys
Tell It To Me: Old Crow Medicine Show
Choctaw Hayride: Alison Krauss & Union Station
Honest Man's Blues: Broken Family Band
American Land: Bruce Springsteen
Dirty Old Town: The Pogues
Little Lion Man: Mumford & Sons
Fat Bottom Girls: Hayseed Dixie
The Twist: Frightened Rabbit
I Love A Rainy Night: Eddie Rabbitt
Minority: Green Day
Chelsea Dagger: The Fratellis
Who Do You Love: Bo Diddley
An Attempt To Tip The Scales: Bright Eyes
The Irish Rover: The Pogues & The Dubliners

Originally posted on thesneakybandit.vox.com
Originally posted on thesneakybandit.vox.com

Tonight I was talking to a girl... this is strange in itself. A girl I met on the internet, which is perhaps not so unusual. She has however got fantastic taste in music and can empathise with the direness of living in the countryside, seemingly a million miles away from the bright lights of the big city. I had hoped this conversation might cheer me up and it would be a sort of chance meeting of minds, like something out of an arty late nineties movie but unfortunately it just served to remind me of how much I miss the bars, the music and all the wee scenesters... still, I'm going to the Limelight tomorrow for what could possibly be one last 'old-skool' hurrah before real adulthood...

I've said it before and no doubt I will say it countless more times to come but I really can't go on living at home with the parents. As much as I love the ability to act like a child, I hate the childish treatment dished out in return. My dad in particular has become an irritable, argumentitive, rude, arrogant and selfish man. I could have punched him last night, only I fight like a girl! I don't even want to be in the same room as him any more... I must move out for the sake of what's left of this family... If being involved in a long-term relationship and having kids leaves us like our parents then I'm perfectly happy as I am!

Ok so the song for Tori didn't end up being what I planned... Instead it's a story of a disillusioned young lady escaping from a shitsville Northern Ireland smalltown in a camper van.

Tune is somewhat inspired by me listening to Green Day's 'Shenanigans' on repeat and lyrically it's like this...

[Verse One]
Hair blowing with the window down.
Leaving this godforsaken town.
She remembers the time she was a girl from Ards.
Jack Daniels and Henry Winterman cigars.
A camper van and a mobile phone.
A change of clothes. She's leaving home.
Glove compartment full of old comic books.
Rear view mirror full of dirty looks.

{Chorus]
Camper, camper, camper van.
Tori's got a brand new camper van.

[Verse Two]
There just isn't a way of knowing.
Where her camp adventure's going.
Packed a map and a couple of beers just in case.
She gets lost in some foreign place.
A flash of orange on the motorway.
White top shining on a sunny day.
There goes Tori camper queen of the road.
Followin' signposts that don't say home.

[Chorus]

The first songwriting challenge was posed by Shauna who requested a song about beards. A quiet half hour in work resulted in what are quite possibly some of the stupidist lyrics I've ever written.

[Verse One]
All this extra hair's a mess
It's all over my face
Makes me look more ginger
It's a fashion disgrace
Still it keeps me warm
And it catches up crumbs
While making me look like
an alcoholic old bum

[Chorus]
But I like her
And she likes boys with beards
I'd do anything for her
I swear I won't shave for years

[Verse Two]
I kissed my mum goodbye
As I left home
She scratched her face and muttered
Something about velcro
I moved in with my girl
I moved into her bed
She'd run her fingers down my face
But all the romance was dead

[Chorus]

[Verse Three]
She used to wake up at night
Just to take a peek
Said she loved it when her hair
Stuck to the side of my cheek
But now I'm lonely and cold
And I'm boking up wine
She left me for some guy
Because he had one longer than mine...

[Chorus]
I still love her
She likes boys with beards
I'd do anything for her
I swear I won't shave for years

I'm stuck in work at the moment. Well actually I'm writing this in work to be typed up later as I tend to do when I'm bored. Bob Marley's 'Jammin'' is on the radio, which would be fine if I was in a convertible car cruising on a balmy summer day or chillin' with a beer in a festival field. But right now it seems to go forever only serving to accentuate the dragging monotony of everyday life.

I remember my French teacher in third year, or year ten as the kids would say now, teaching us the phrase "metro, boulot, dodo" which sums up the aforementioned daily drudgery in a way that only the French could do.

Basically a typical day chez Scott goes a little like this: Wake up, drive to work, work, drive home for lunch, eat, watch the news, drive back to work, work, drive home again, eat, watch Hollyoaks, watch the Emmerdale/Coronation Street/Eastenders combo, check emails, watch the show that Lindsay says I talk too much about and then treat my ears to something musical before bedtime. Class or what!?

Thankfully I have updated the last couple of days with anecdotes from years gone by so to shed a little light relief on your brains and a little look at things that have shaped the man I am... I hope you've commented the songwriting blog!

It's a Sunday night and there was band practise after church. Any other week I'd be beaming like a 100 Watt lightbulb due to having spent a couple of hours in the company of an amazingly beautiful, not to mention talented girl. In fact in many ways, the same girl has had the same effect on me for years.

It all started in 1993. I was twelve years old and she was eleven. She'd moved up from Sunday School into the Bible Class that us bigger kids went to. In some kind of psychotically pathetic way I can still remember what she was wearing the first time I really noticed her. I believed in love at first sight but I was fat and ginger and astutely aware that those were not traits desired in a man by pretty blonde girls. So I sat quietly in the back corner of the room and wondered what it would be like to have a girl like that as a girlfriend.

We went to different schools and so Sunday mornings was the only time I got to see her. I didn't miss a week of church for about three years! A little further down the line we ended up at the same grammar school. Obviously we'd both grown up and she was more beautiful than ever. She dated other guys and I tried everything to win her over. I went back to church. She was a singer so I offered to play keyboards and guitar. She liked rugby players so I worked my ass off to make the team playing alongside current Irish international Rory Best. One of the other guys on the team told me once after practise that she went down easy in the back of a car and called her "blowjob Anna". My fist ended up covered in blood from his face.

I resigned myself to the fact that she would never be interested in me and so in true soap opera style I tried dating a couple of her friends. In true soap opera style it ended in disaster. Eventually we both moved up to Belfast to university. I missed the geeky value of turning up early for maths class so I would see her coming out of the class before. The only time I saw her was the occasional brief encounter in the Mandela Hall or Spring And Airbrake where it was a real case of beauty and the beast. The good-looking blonde and the scruffy drunk. A sort of George and Alex Best... only I couldn't play football and neither of us were famous outside our own imaginations. Now we're both back in Portadown and I have regained that childish eleven year old boy infatuation. Ah well, I give it a few months... "I can't take my mind off you, 'til I find somebody new."

Today's entry was brought to you in association with The Wonder Years.

A long time ago, well a few years back, a young man called Peter Wilson commended the songwriting of a band called Buttermonkey. Peter Wilson grew up to become Duke Special and the songwriting genius behind Buttermonkey was less fortunate to wind up as me.

Peter liked some of the songs I'd written, applauding the quirky wit and humour, which was according to him a series of almost throwaway lines with hidden intelligence. The particular song in question was called "Hollywood Girl". It wasn't about a Co. Down girl... not like Ash's infamous "Girl From Ards"! Instead it was a slow riffing tale of woe as the rise and fall of an imaginary lust-fuelled relationship is played out in the mind of our young protagonist. The girl in question was Sarah Michelle Gellar and as if that wasn't enough it sampled Britney Spears' "Lucky".

I wasn't used to having such praise heaped on me. It was like when as an eight year old, my football coach stated that I was an alright player as long as I didn't stray too far from the centre circle or that first gig review when I was described as "not as bad as I though you were going to be!"

Now however, I need to start writing songs again. Since moving home and doing the nine to five thing I have been severely hindered creatively. I blame the lack of alcohol and experiences. If you all would be so kind as to leave a comment suggesting a song theme I will try my best to write you one. Previous attempts at this have sparked such masterpieces as "Geek", "The Penguin Song", "I Love You, You Turd" and "The Stupid Emo Song". Get me writing now!!!

Several things have gone in the last twenty four hours. Firstly my beard sacrificed itself to the lure of the plughole leaving my face looking like a stubbly teenager trying to impress his pre-pubescent friends. There is still too much chocolate in the diet to risk a full wet shave thus prompting the sexually repulsive spotty-razor-rash.

In no particular order in televisionsville Jodie Marsh has gone from the Big Brother house. I still have a little bit of sympathy for her because she was picked on relentlessly by two or three grown men who really should know better. Bullying is not big and not clever... If charity wristbands were still the vogue du jour I'd be wearing my little blue anti-bullying one!

While on the subject of Big Brother and wrists (although not limp ones in particular) I lead my thoughts on to Mr Michael Barrymore. Any sort of respect I may ever have had for the man has long since gone. Arsehole. That's all.

And finally (said a la Trevor McDonald) the final thing to go, and in many ways much more importantly, was my letter of resignation to Morton Newspapers. I am now, to coin a footballing term, a free agent and have made myself available before the end of the January transfer window. As of February 10th I will be back at GCAS Networks designing pretty little websites. Yes!!!

It's Thursday which means that series one of Lost is over. The boy The Others wanted was Walt and not baby Aaron. The hatch appears to be some sort of shaft to middle earth, Arzt is in pieces after a dynamite related faux pas and Locke is being equally philosophical and shifty. I had high hopes for there being some sort of 'finding themselves' revelations, however while a few characters have got some sort of closure on the ragged torn pieces of their lives, there are still a lot of unanswered questions and tetchy relationships hanging in the air along with the black smoke waiting for series two. Oh yeah, and they're still on the island!

Dear Pete Burns...
You may well think that you are the epitome of all that was cool in the eighties. You may even have a line of fans longer than the queue behind you for the bathroom but in my opinion (which after all is all that matters in this LJ) you are a washed up old has been with the attitude of a worldweary middle ages trailer park mom!

So your plastic surgery went wrong? So you wear a coat made out of a monkey? So you used to be one of the indie cool kids? If this was 1985 you may still grace the cover of NME but it's 2006 now and that place is reserved for whippersnapper pretty boys like Preston rather than middle aged men who look like Lily Savage after a night out on the town with Charlotte Church.

I would however like to have something nice to say about your personality because as Maggot tells us... all this negative energy is bad, man! Unfortunately I don't. You are an image obsessed moron. You are free to leave the diary room... you are free to leave the house... hell feel free to leave my TV screen forever.

Disregards
Scott

Dear God of TV, that is not you Eamonn Holmes or Parky no matter what you think... thank you for the wonderful scheduling on Channel 4 and E4 at this most boring and depressing time of my life. As Lost was drawing to an end I found myself in a state of despair but now I have lots to look forward to in life. The return of The OC, Desperate Housewives, ER and new shows like invasion all on top of Celebrity Big Brother have made my otherwise pathetically meaningless life complete. Sitting in the parental house night after night in front of the telly has also done wonders for my alcohol problem. This is all I have to say for now. Amen and stuff...

It's the first weel of January which means we've all forgotten about New Year Resolutions and the like. It's also means it's FA Cup Third Round time...

I must say I actually enjoyed the Luton-Liverpool game today. It was a fantastic game, action packed and actually reminded me of why I used to like watching football.

Now football is a sport for the rich and famous, for slightly talented goodlooking boys with their minds on hookers, beers, modelling contracts, their fit women and fat wallets.

Thank God the FA Cup comes around where crap little teams take it to the big guys and play with pride and spirit rather than expensive boots and massive egos.

More matches like this one please... only without Liverpool winning them, thanks.

I'm writing this in work today. Fear not, we at Morton Newspapers have not yet embraced the technological revolution. I am scribbling on a bit of copy paper - a sort of rough version before I type it up good and submit it for your approval. Today's little mentionable bit is more of a local feature in that it's about me!

In work I am a lazy good-for-nothing. I hate selling advertisements and I don't even agree with the principles behind either advertising or tele-sales. My plan here was to make a little money for myself before getting the sack for my patheticness. And so without furher ado I was hauled into the boss' office this morning. At last, the disciplinary action and P45 I'd always dreamed of...

Well, no actually, I got promoted! It's a funny old world...

There are only two things worth mentioning today which is a pretty sad state of affairs. Then again, recently I have been struggling to come up with one mentionworthy item to LiveJournalise.

Today's big news for readers of a highbrow nature is the 'shock' revelation that Charles Kennedy has been battling a drink problem for the past couple of years. He's a ginger man, slightly overweight, of Celtic origin and working in a very stressful environment. Therefore an affinity for the strong stuff is hardly mindblowingly surprising. I have a lot of respect for the man. It's much easier to live in denial and to go on deluding yourself and others. Unfortunately the rest of the Liberal Democrats don't see it that way and seem to have lost faith in their leader. By all accounts great men like Churchill enjoyed a few scoops but Mr Kennedy is something else... a politician who tells the truth... whatever next!?

Meanwhile, back in the real world we have entered another series of Celebrity Big Brother and the fakes and fraudsters have filled the house with more unsightly plastic than you'd find in your average landfill site. After the launch show I have seen no reason other than my own morbid curiosity to keep watching. Chantelle, the non-celebrity has me intrigued. She seems quite nice despite having the appearance of Barbie's trashy younger sister. The most enjoyable moment of the show was watching the amazing reception the British public gave Michael Barrymore. Only a few years ago he'd been banished to TV purgatory over allegations of this, that and the other... mostly the other, it has to be said. It was nice to see a proper entertainer back on the small screen... "Awwwwiiight!?"

When I was at "wee school" (you know the good old days when all you had to worry about was going to "big school") there were two girls who used to argue in the playground. They would argue over everything and anything. Then they started to grow up and as the old saying goes 'put away their childish things...' Well, there's no chance of a career for them in Northern Irish politics then!!!

Today I subjected myself to listening to a little while of William Crawley's radio show on Radio Ulster. If I hadn't been sitting in a company car at the time I would have launched the radio straight out of the window! The main topic of the day was an argument between some faceless nobody from Sinn Fein and his equally illustrious SDLP counterpart who had allegedly raised a glass to toast the Queen at some function or other.

Here is a brief paraphrased summary of the debate...

Sinn Fein: Are you slabberin' at me?
SDLP: Are you slabberin' at me?
Sinn Fein: I said nathin'
SDLP: You started it...
Sinn Fein: No you started it...
SDLP: I said nathin'
Sinn Fein: Aye yer ma!

and so on and so on...

Ah, if only it had been Stephen Nolan he would've cut both these idiots off.

On a more positive note for local democracy, the stupidity of both men was surpassed by that of the journalist 'hosting' the debate who used such expression s as "you have failed to miss point..." Surely if one fails to miss a point then they get the point, no? On top of that it seems like BBC journos can't tell the GCSE English definition difference between slander and libel... for future reference Mr Crawley: Two grown men slagging each other off on air is slander... me typing 'Crawley you're a twat' now that is libel!!!

Today was the day affectionately named as 'back to porridge' by my boss. If she used that phrase once she used it a hundred times today, only refraining to tell me stories of Christmas and New Years fun and the odd tall tale about cute little puppy dogs. I could throttle her if I was that way inclined.

I spent another seven whole hours pretending to sell ads I didn't want to sell to people who don't want to buy them. Surely this can't be as good as working life gets. I forgot to remember my mum's birthday and was so late out of work that all the shops had closed... to improve my mood a little, the crazy drivers of Portadown had caused several road accidents in the town meaning it took me well over an hour to get home.

I spent the rest of the evening typing up new CV's and faking an entire design portfolio in a bid to increase my job hunting prospects for 2006. Now I'm going to MSN for a bit and sleep. Stop me if the excitement gets too much...

The big news of the day, if not the whole year so far is that thesneakybandit is marking 2006 with the re-emergence of the beard.

What exactly does this all signify? Beards in history tend to favour the bad guys... Bluto in the Popeye cartoons right through to Bueller Tannen in Back To The Future III.

Of course it's not a purely fictional phenomenon. Look at the examples of the bearded Liam Gallagher losing it at The Brits in '96 and walking back off the infamous American tour. The bearded Paul McCartney in the slammer for drug related offences in the late 60's.

Compare with the marked improvement of Kings Of Leon once they got rid of the ZZ Top look and the scruffy bad boy image of facial hair clad Russel Crow and Colin Farrell. In fact you know that if Pete Doherty had hit puberty he would also be a bearded man.

So what does a beard signify for the bandit? In previous forms it has served to hide the red-bloated alcoholic hidden inside or to cover the shame on the face of someone who really should know better.

In conclusion, beards are evil and right now... I'm bearded!

I fully intended to write a cliched LiveJournal review of the year. It was my initial reaction to the start of another year and in some ways it would have made a patheitcly sad, depressed, lonely end to what had be a thoroughly awful year. I could even have typed it up last night and posted it on the stroke of midnight but alas Jools Holland and the pretty face of KT Tunstall kept me occupied and saved me from the humiliation of New Years' Eve internet posting.

2005 was the one year that I've had in my life where I could really make a huge difference in not only my own life but the lives of others. Instead I wasted my months on binge drinking, over-rated gigs and pursuing things I didn't really need to. At this exact time last year I was probably still hungover, suffering stomach cramps and sporadically oozing blood and puss from the spide-dealt black eye I'd received outside The Emerald. I was about to embark on a year of charity campaigning and busting a gut to change the world in whatever way I could. I'd been dumped and was young, free, single and living life to the full. Most of my LiveJournal from last year is full of words and photos from drunken nights and forgotten mornings.

In the following twelve months I have nosedived into a horrendous job, living with my parents, spending every little amount of cash I can scrape together on car insurance and housekeeping... I attend social functions on a less than monthly basis and most of my "friends" are 100 x 100 pixel avatars accompanied by usernames which are meaningful only to those who choose them. This is where I'm at...

I may write again.
Happy New Year.

ok so the word on the street is that thesneakybandit doesn't update this thing enough!

well last night i got all sentimental about the good old days  of livejournalling... what could have prompted this? well sipping jd and coke, talking to little emo's in auntie annie's and bitching about aaron lol... ah how very 2005!

yes there was drinks, dancing, kissing and the pogues... hmm also cigars if i remember correctly!

enjoy jack daniels responsibly this christmas!
28) if gingerchris and pixiemeat103 were siamese twins, where would they be joined?

first club attended as a 24 year old: the limelight

first people spoken to as a 24 year old: andy, lucy, manda, nikki, des and grainne

first song danced to as a 24 year old: i bet you look good on the dancefloor (i bet i didn't)

first kiss as a 24 year old: hawt drummer from london/myspaz with great highlights, shit jeans and a record deal on the way

there were no photos of this historic event thankfully... a more full update will not follow... it is now bedtime, goodnight y'all!

dear loyalist youths of belfast,

firstly may i offer some wayne rooney-esque referee applause to those delightful little children of the loyalist estates. yes, you the sportswear clad arsefuckers who put a hole in the drivers door of my lovely silver fiesta. i smile wryly at your extreme lack of intellect and bemuse myself for the rest of the evening wondering why the fuck you even exist at all. for future reference... aiming bricks at the bodywork of a car will do fuck all but dent the paintwork and the pride of its owner. a trained monkey would realise that windows are much more apt as a target. especially the front. also next time consider using something flammable. after watching a summer-long broadcast of flying petrol bombs and fireworks, i was disappointed that all you had for me was a few bricks and a bit of a tree. well when i say a bit of a tree, i actually mean a stick... in fact i've seen more impressive wood in cheap german porn.

anyway now my car has a hole of exactly the same size and proportions as a brick in the drivers-side door and my passive nature has been tested a little. a little? who am i kidding? if i had an ak47 handy i'd line every one of you little fuckers up against a wall and let rip like those depressed american marilyn manson fans do on an average day in school. maybe i'll let you off easy though. i mean it's hardly your fault that you were born and raised the bastard sons and daughters of pretension, bigotry and hatred. what do your beliefs mean to you now? for the last howevermany years all we've heard from you is "the fenians this" "the fenians that" and now you don't know who you're fighting for or against. every ounce of dignity you little paramilitary parasites ever had has gone, pissed away like tennents lager down the u-bend of the pisser in some dingy backstreet bar.

that's about all i have to say on the matter. i just don't understand this enough to even begin to articulate thoughts. you were all about ten years old. at that age at seven on a tuesday night i'd have been buried in homework. why not try it sometime? seriously it'll pass the hours until your mum gets back from banging her fancyman and your dad gets home on parole. failing that, why not watch eastenders... it'll depress the life out of you and make you feel that your shitty pathetic little existence maybe isn't so bad. now take that rangers scarf from over your mouth, young man... you'll not know the benefit of it when you go out!

yours in disgust,
thesneakybandit

unlike the late great ronnie barker and ira weapons... thesneakybandit is still around somewhere...

somewhere with a shit computer-less job, no social life and no reason at all to update ever...

well apart from this!

ENJOY THESNEAKYBANDIT RESPONSIBLY...

lj interests meme results

  1. beatles:
    the franzferdinand of their day, they took drugs and walked barefoot across zebra crossings...
  2. chinese:
    a whole culture comprising of chicken balls, sweet and sour sauce, half rice, half chips, served in a polystyrene conatiner and best eaten when drunk...
  3. e-mails:
    words on a screen that come to your computer from friends and assholes alike...
  4. funeral for a friend:
    emo boys who play loud guitars and wear black and scream and stuff...
  5. internet:
    some invisible thing that exists in america where it survives full of pornographic images and illegal music...
  6. magazines:
    the same thing as number five there but back in the days when we had no computers and things were written on pages instead...

    the art of going to places... something which people did more of before the price of petrol went up...

and another thing... hands up who thinks ginger chris should have an lj for when he goes away to canadia!!! well a metaphorical 'hands-up' in the style of posting a comment will do. he's listening.

it's been a long time coming. i've been sitting at home, mildly mannered, biting my tongue but this has got to stop. let's have a look at my current five worst places to live in the world... at number five... democratic republic of congo... number four, basra... up two places to number three, israel, new entry at number two is new orleans and still at number one. NORNFUCKINGIRELAND! yes kids welcome to hell... i now have a broken tv... i lost it. i couldn't stand to watch any more shite bbc-driven propaganda behind orange lines. everybody spouting complete and utter irrelevant bollocks like "republicanism is incompatible with orangism", "loyalism is incompatible with...", unionism is incompatible with..." let me cut a long story short for you... being a decent human being is incompatible with living in this godforsaken country. now the first thing shown on the 'behind orange lines' program was a list of what a good orangeman should be. this illustrious list included such wonderful attributes as being a good christian, being a good neighbour, being a loyal british subject... umm... so that would be just like that law abiding, godfearing gentleman in his collarette who hacked at a policeman with a fucking sword or that jumped up loyalist thug bailey standing in rangers shirt and refusing to condemn the total nonsensical violence of the last week. "i'm not condemning anything..." as has been widely said in norn iron over the last thirty years... jesus fuckin' wept!!! yes ladies and gentleman, welcome to northern ireland where you will be hauled up and prosecuted for doing 35 in a 30 zone or failing to pay a tv license but should you venture up on the roof of your house and throw flaming missiles and rocks at the security forces who were put in place for your own protection then you get a pat on the back from some loyalist brigadeer up some dark alleyway and get primetime tv coverage enough to keep jordan and peter andre's wedding out of the news. oh no, wait... the security forces are allowed to respond... yes with a glorified watering can!!! sprinkle a little water on the violent, uneducated scum. they'll need colling off if they stand too close to all those burning milk bottles. act like a terrorist in england and get five bullets in the head even if you're innocent. it's not rocket science to realise that something somewhere has gone horribly wrong. still anyway it could be worse... we could be american... the nation with not enough money to haul the rotting corpses of the poor from diseased flood water becuase they're too busy opening a new disneyworld in hong kong... but that's another rant for another day... oh yeah and i've started work as a sales executive... maybe this is as good as it gets!

i've been working for a little while and this place is even more lacklustre and soul destroying than i ever remember. so today i have made a list of what to go and see when i get to the greenbelt festival.

01. iain archer
02. jim moray
03. john davis
04. the amazing pilots
05. onehundredhours
06. the proclaimers
07. ricky ross
08. juliet turner
09. johnny parks
10. duke special

and on a non music front...

01. my movie soundtrack
02. the complete works of shakespeare in 97 minutes
03. pulp (comic book exhibition not jarvis cocker et co.)

that's all for now. further ramblings later if i can be arsed...

stupid little emo song

the first time that i saw her
we argued over fightstar
i couldn't take my eyes off her pretty eyeliner
i made her a cd
of songs i heard on tv
no one i ever met ever looked so sad and pretty

she left her number in my hall
on black marker on the wall
the landlord fined me for the damage before i could even call
she bought me a stripey top
and an emo belt from topshop
we dated for a while until it all came to a stop

coz i don't have converse trainers
i don't look like adam brody
i'd choose avril lavigne before kim deal or brody
i'm not man enough to split up with her
in person face to face
so i just leave her online messages on myspace

the last time that i saw her
we argued in a bar
she poured bacardi breezer on my little black guitar
i made her a cd
of songs i heard on tv
no one i ever met ever fucked me up so badly
i just wanted to dance
to my chemical romance
only stopping for a second to adjust my baggy pants
in the limelight back to school bop
it all came to a stop
i went home a lit a fire with her stupid stripey top

coz i don't have converse trainers etc......

thursday morning saw the beginnings of the almost new me. it was all shirts, ties, cv's and the like as i headed off to morton newspapers for an interview for a job which i don't really want. after that i ventured back up to the city to start work back at gcas. i looked somewhat pratlike in my shirt and tie in the ever so casual world of web-design but sure i'm only covering there for a week and no one knows me there anymore so that was fine.

friday was more of the same. i'd forgotten how bloody tedious working on amends on the stena line website can be and how busy this place gets on a friday. the staff are not as good looking as i remember and i'm bored of the place already. bring on more interviews and better prospects please. rebecca and chris have been texting me about going out somewhere sometime. chris has been staying in the holiday inn for some reason to do with work training or something.

saturday hmm yes, well where do i start? richard's stag party started in the fly. another person's hen party arrived and scary girls shouted at us. we got somewhat scared and left. then we headed downtown and called into the morning star. it was pretty empty and we got chatted up by some oul doll and an american/canadian guy offered to give me a free pint. again i was a little scared and we made a swift exit. next stop was the john hewitt for a 'traditional session' but the place was too packed to move so we headed instead to the duke of york which was a little better. there were some rather nice looking ladies in there, one of whom was wearing a 'long walk to justice' wristband which means she'd been at the edinburgh live eight gig. i sat wanting to start some kind of conversation but i'm no good at that sort of thing. eventually as tends to happen around elevenish we wanted to dance so it was time for a limelight excursion. double vodka's and coke were maybe not the best idea from the start but the limelight was fun for a while. did a bit of dancing which hasn't been done in a while and spotted the same girls from the duke of york. the second time around though i was prepared to start a conversation, however still sober enough to realise that i was talking drunken nonsense and they were out of my league so i remained quiet. other girls were quite nice to me even though they had drinks thrown at them for standing near me!

[emo eljay bit]
I DON'T KNOW IF YOU READ MY JOURNAL OR NOT. NOTHING EVER HAPPENED BETWEEN US. NOTHING EVER WILL. YOU ARE A FUCKING PSYCHO AND I WOULD GREATLY APPRECIATE YOU FUCKING AWAY OFF OUT OF MY LIFE FOREVER. THAT'S ALL.
[/emo eljay bit]

apologies to the girls who got stella'd. after those shenanigans i talked to mr duke special for a while about something or other and discussed the upcoming greenbelt festival. buskers stage here i come! somehow i ended up back at jude's house wandering about the streets looking for richard and then wandering off home while chris passed out on the floor. wellesley and derryvolgie avenue seemed very far apart.

once i heard a sort of urban legend about a friend of a friend of someone who drank so  much that they threw up a mixture of shit and blood. this is possible. i need say no more on the subject. sunday was a glorious day of watching f1, getting the train home, filling the toilets in portadown station with boke, watching the chelsea game and sleeping. i still feel rough as...

i had a wee look around and although i don't have my mp3 collection anymore i did find the tracklisting for anja's mixtape... so here it is... side one bright eyes : at the bottom of everything johnny cash : a boy named sue [live] arcade fire : laika snow patrol : ask me how i am charlotte hatherley : kim wilde [live] [something by the chalets] ash : starcrossed manic street preachers : motown junk [live] kid carpet : jump the killers : somebody told me [remix] futureheads : hounds of love [remix] [something by oppenheimer] side two weezer : butterfly ryan adams : tennessee sucks willy mason : oxygen stellastar : my coco [something by the gossip] fighting with wire : after the show the mascara story : this is not a bruise blondie : rip her to shreds the debonaires : spide mobile goldfrapp : ooh la la beck : girl graham coxon : no good time hmm and while i'm at it i suppose. here's the tracklisting for the tape i never got around to giving to tori... side one deathcab for cutie : lack of color weezer : falling for you green day : give me novacaine the weakerthans : aside finch : letters to you alkaline trio : stupid kid snow patrol : favourite friend senses fail : save yourself dashboard confessional : rapid hope loss benzine headset : superhero the debonaires : all these battles bloc party : this modern love the cure : friday i'm in love side two reindeer section : will you please be there for me the beach boys : don't talk (lay your head on my shoulder) five dollar soul : red, black and blue eels : beautiful freak edgeweather : when it feels like you're losing the valentines : star crossed lovers beki hemingway : fort bragg ryan adams : come pick me up kathryn williams : all apologies rem : at my most beautiful david mcnair : star duke special : love is a series of scars the skatalites : batman theme

i have nothing worth updating about. my life revolves entirely around television and the contents of jobfinder. thusly the week has passed me by in this sort of fashion...

monday:
the sooner the big brother farce is over the better. makosi and craig must be eliminated. i don't mean voted out of the house, i mean silenced with some sort of high calibre rifle. i have applied to work as a journo with a new magazine called 'globalclub'. i am currently pretending to be down with the kids. not in the michael jackson way though.

tuesday:
back in the old days tuesday would have been a limelight night. lately it's been 'sugar rush' night. the series is over now and i have no more ginger lesbianism and teen angst to empathise with. i must go and find out who played the hot northern irish lady though. i have applied to work as a website editor or suchlike with culturenorthernireland.org.

wednesday:
i didn't have to go cold turkey from red-headed-lady-love. i am being weaned off slowly. the tatu video for all the things she said was shown twice today. little russian girls are my gay-methadone substitute. my shit-media-hungry eyes have been helped by a double dose of 'lost'. this may be more addictive than 24. gcas networks have offered me one weeks work starting on the 18th.

thursday:
one night of big brother to go and the snivelling-gay-bunny-boiling-psycho has gone. praise the lord if he is in charge of such things. otherwise praise to the channel four media moghuls and the great british public. i am not recovering from radiation this week although i am missing the emo and paid a visit to specsavers to try on some gogs-specs.

friday:
i watched it. anthony won. that's all.

saturday:
the premiership has kicked off with no pun intended there. malcolm glazer redshirts soccer federation have got off to a winning start. i appear to be somewhat cynical already. there is a lot of nakedness in 'shakespeare in love'. i wasn't expecting that. i'd recommended it to my mother. glasto highlights are on now. goodbye.

here's a little list of what i remember from radiation. trust me this will not take long...

i arrivd in belfast and drank a good bit of vodka. i walked down to the limelight with chris and rebecca. dazcraig asked me if i was going out with rebecca. i met lucy and anja and hugged. i waved at doodle. i asked lucy for a doodle tattoo. i dropped a pint of stella. i asked dazcraig to play 'scott's a dork' by reel big fish. next thing i remember was having a paranoia attack in rebecca's house... something to do with a wheely bin. then i woke up in my old room in my old flat in my boxers and and an old sleeping bag.

this morning i discovered i also lost my bank card and fifteen quid from my wallet. this info will not be gracing the pages of the new cv i am typing!

for all those who asked, i shall be making a brief 3rd august comeback special at xdoodleationx mainly due to my admiration of those mascara story boys (in a non-ghey way) and a chance to show off my new/old sunglasses woot!

so life at home is well pretty much as expected. angry words have been exchanged between the young and old on a whole matter of subjects ranging from the racist, xenophobic opinions of my parents, the fact that according to my mother I have lost my culture and heritage and the recurring why have you not got a job yet conversation. I don't know how long I can put up with living here... especially with everyone posting lj's, emailing and texting me to tell me how great everything is while I'm gone. I failed to get my confirmation back to auntie annie's in time and missed out on working at oxegen. I stayed in on the 12th and 13th avoiding the sectarian shithole I call my hometown. I have had to throw out countless bits and pieces of my childhood and adolescence as there is no longer room in my room for the current life I lead. football shirts and shit cd's can now be purchased in oxfam along with various pc packages for windows 95/98. I recycled some old song lyrics and ceremonially tore up some ex-photos. this has been the extent of the excitement of my life lately so you'll forgive me for not bothering to update this. presently I am practising some horrendous acoustic covers for a church hall gig that I have in ballynahinch on 29th july. hmm acoustic gig for christians... well that'll be damien rice, james blunt, snow patrol and travis then! I might play some my chemical romance though because I'm not o-fucking-kay... trust me! the highlight of the week was watching series one of 24 over two days. I'd actually never watched the show before and discovered my wee brother has the whole thing on dvd. he can't watch it anyhow as he's just undergone laser surgery on his eyes and needs a week or two for things to come back into focus. so now he's spec-free and had to spend almost three grand to get it done. if only I could actually have no social life like him and earn some money!!! right now I have less than twenty quid in the bank which means I can barely even afford transport to belfast never mind the funding for a night out. I need a haircut but feel bad about using up almost half of my entire life savings to get it done... moan, moan, moan etc. on a more positive note I found thirty quids worth of hmv vouchers so I took a little trip to the rushmere centre, which looks eerily like royal avenue with a roof and made some purchases. luckily for me they had a sale and thirty pounds bought me this... martha wainwright's self titled album, happiness in magazines by ex-blur man graham coxon, weezer's pinkerton (the definitive album of those who were too cool for school), pulp's different class (updating from tape) and x-men 1 and 2 on dvd. hurrah for the sales!

jamie cullum and the future mrs edgar...


a big white band around murrayfield...


each click represents someone somewhere in africa who dies just because they are too poor to live...


glad i got in before this lot!


travis... why does it always rain on them?


bob, bono and midge... the celtic poverty warriors...

so when i last left this endearing little blue and white site i was reminiscing about the super smooth and relatively fast and easy crossing to stranraer in only ninety minutes aboard the stena hss... ah i really must remember that i no longer work in web marketing for stena line!

the journey's end was edinburgh where the locals could have picked up a few tips from the oirish on how to bring july in with a proper riot. nothing was set on fire, no one was intimidated out of their homes and a few park benches were thrown through the windows of burger king. yeh don't mess with those scummy, dreadlocked, socialist wasters!!! i was there for purely moral reasons, armed with only a make poverty history banner and a very large supply of crisps. i sent tori a text on the off chance that she might have already shipped out to edinburgh but as always she didn't reply ;)

after being pissed on with a vengence from the heavens we made it out to murrayfield for one of the greatest gigs i've ever been to. yes... ronan keating, the thrills, the corrs, keane, travis, texas, annie lennox and mcfly... it was like listening to radio two but it was sublime!!! snow patrol, travis, the proclaimers and james brown stole the show completely. some little fat glaswegian woman pissed me off by not allowing us to fly our supersize banner. it was one hell of an experience... seeing bob geldof and bono do their thing on stage was memorable to say the least. i'm proud to have been a little part of it.

sleeping arrangements were on the floor of napier halls on a less than comfy airbed and sharing with a highly amorous young couple. alcohol would normally have been required but i was intent on doing without. well done me!

tuesday, wednesday and thursday all blurred into one until thursday night where the week ended with frisky disco... just where it all began. the less said about that the better!!! she had a lovely appartment and a double bed...... trails off into insignificance.

check back tomorrow for my anti-terrorism rant and a catch up on the weekend etc. and maybe even a few photos if i can be arsed!

it's been a long time coming... i've been away for awhile, filling my brain with thoughts and filling every ounce of my heart and soul with equal measures of hatred and all out despair... and as if that wasn't enough, i've also missed what was apparently the best.radeeashun.evar!

the last thing my livejournal remembers is venturing out to frisky disco over a week ago with daz, gogs and niall to drink pints of stella, vodka and coke, and flyer the indiegirls. that was quite the messy evening and i don't altogether remember too much about the walk home. i was up and ready for work at 7am though so it can't have been too bad... anyway, here is a quick rundown of all that has happened since... strap yourselves in and prepare for quite a journey... low-level lighting will guide you to your nearest exit.

summer madness was as aptly named this year as any ronseal product. it sunned and pissed down in equal measures indicateing a true norn iron summer and was crazy and zany in a way which scarily only christian festivals can be. i never really made it too far out of the christian aid venue although i did play a great wee buskers singalong set in the tearfund tent. i must congratulate myself on our venue as it was incredibly almost brilliant and pretty much 90% of what i had imagined in my head. there were some good times... i met hullosqueeze and got the hots for one of my own volunteering staff, i also got to have a security radio and wielded it with authority banning several little arseholes from my venue... do not assume that because this is a christian festival that the kids will not be complete cunts! many of them have been kindly donated by tired parents whose only solution to the summer holidays is to send them to "that holy thing on up at the king's hall!" i also bumped into rudedoodle's wee brother who is sporting some wonderfully summerful-rasta hair!

the entertainment in our wee venue kicked off with a traditional irish night... who's got the balls to kick off the marching season with a folk band playing the fields of athenry to a bunch of ballymena presbyterians... oh yes!!! we also had a traditional african night which descended into a session of us all learning breakdancing moves as well as a brilliantly cheesy seventies night.

tuesday morning of last week was spent demolishing the venue and starting the clear up job before heading down to the stena line terminal and onto the hss for a little jaunt over to the country they named after me...

more on this later tonight...

my choices for last nightwere as follows. go to see batman begins with thirty students from arkansas or go to the movie night at common grounds with an ex-girlfriend and a randomn mate who i would only meet for the first time when i got there. here follows the hot and not of retro movie night.

hot:
====
free pizza and doritos
the ratio of girls to boys
the quality of retro movies
the nice american girls
marty's mom in '55

not:
====
the general lack of punters
the uncomfortable chairs
people complaining about the projector widescreen ratios
not starting two hours earlier and watching number three as well!!!

"now make like a tree and get outta here!"
